result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Marcus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: 2nd/Sub. Drug Off.-Class E/F/G/H/I Fel.], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: EACH OTHER AS TO BOTH COUNTS and Any other sentence; Release for The Day Reporting Center and HOC treatment or any other HOC programs; with credit for 63 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring

miscConds.notes:
BOTH COUNTS: Provide DNA sample, if not already done. Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Fine is set at ZERO.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.

- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- Court ordered defendant to comply with all Child Support Court orders.
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the  manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes: WITHOUT GOODTIME CREDIT; Release for The Day Reporting Center (if eligible). Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. FORTHWITH.

Defendant Kenneth Marcus in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Kenneth Marcus in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. 

AS TO COUNT 3:
Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent to Count 4 and to any other sentence; release for The Day Reporting Center and HOC treatment or any other HOC programs; with credit for 63 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

AS TO COUNT 4:
Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent to Count 3 and to any other sentence; release for The Day Reporting Center and HOC treatment or any other HOC programs; with credit for 63 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.  
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Seek/Maintain full time employment.  
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.

AS TO COUNT 3: 
- Court ordered defendant to serve 130 DAYS CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction with out goodtime credit; release for The Day Reporting Center (if eligible). Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. FORTHWITH. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Letter received on behalf of the Defendant and Filed. LNR

Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.

Plea hearing proceeded. Case passed. Case recalled. Same appearance. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered counts dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 3 AND 4 :
The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  

Parties prepared to proceed to sentencing, but due to the time of the day, case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 09-14-2016 at 8:30, branch 17.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.   Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #05CF2566 that are attached to the complaint. Sworn for the state: Matthew Tracy, City of Milwaukee Police Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.
